thread.title: LOCAL SPORTS ROUNDUP (Tuesday events): Somerset Berkley golfers Jared Silva, AJ Guidotti qualify for state tourney
thread.title_full: LOCAL SPORTS ROUNDUP (Tuesday events): Somerset Berkley golfers Jared Silva, AJ Guidotti qualify for state tourney

author: Herald News Staff
title: LOCAL SPORTS ROUNDUP (Tuesday events): Somerset Berkley golfers Jared Silva, AJ Guidotti qualify for state tourney
text: LOCAL SPORTS ROUNDUP (Tuesday events): Somerset Berkley golfers Jared Silva, AJ Guidotti qualify for state tourney Comment The Herald News, Fall River, MA By Herald News Staff Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 10:06 PM Updated at 10:32 PM Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 10:06 PM Updated at 10:32 PM • Felipe Silva nets a pair of goals in BCC men's soccer win over Roxbury... Herald News Staff Somerset Berkley finished in fourth place out of 13 schools in the Division 2 South Shore sectional team golf tournament at Easton Country Club on Tuesday. The Raiders finished with a team score of 324. Duxbury was tops at 299. Jared Silva (74) and AJ Guidotti (76) led the Raiders and qualified for the individual tournament which will take place on Monday at Crumpin Fox Golf Club in Bernardston. Boys’ Soccer Durfee 2, Bishop Feehan 1: At Attleboro, second-half goals by Anis Larbi and Connor Riley gave the Hilltoppers (7-4-2) this win. William Sobreiro and Justin Moniz had assists. Riley’s goal came on a beautiful shot, high to the corner, from 10 feet beyond the penalty area. Winning keeper William Boner made 10 saves. Somerset Berkley 5, Bishop Stang 2: At Somerset, Troy Matos, Nate Pacheco, Nate Pereira, Drew DeCoste, and Andrew Farias scored for the Raiders (9-4-1, 4-3 league) in this Eastern Athletic Conference game. Dakota Vertentes, Sean Davies, and DeCoste added assists, and Evan Magnuson (4 saves) was the winning keeper. For Stang, Jake Carlson (penalty kick) and Evan Peek (from Tyler Trate) scored late, after SB had gone up 5-0. Girls’ Soccer Bishop Stang 3, Somerset Berkley 0: At Bishop Stang in Dartmouth, Rebecca Michaud, Isabella Shields, and Rylie Carreau scored in this Eastern Athletic Conference game. Mary Rishmany posted the two-save shutout. Stang is 9-2-3 overall, 2-2-2 EAC. Boys’ Cross Country Diman 20, Tri-County 38: At Franklin (3.1 miles), the Bengals upped their record to 12-0 with this Mayflower Athletic Conference win. Diman’s Chris Novo (18:38) and Zach Melo (18:49) took 1-2, and the Bengals’ Nathan Boardman (19:36) and Evan Arruda (19:42) came in 4-5. Also for Diman, Aaron Gouveia (19:53) was eighth and Joshua Brockman (19:54) ninth. Norfolk Agricultural 28, Bishop Connolly 29: At Walpole (3.1 miles), Mitchell Carter (18:46) of the Cougars took first place in this Mayflower Athletic Conference meet. Connolly (4-6) also got top 10 finishes from Nathaniel Diniz (2nd, 18:55), Elliott Pawlak (6th, 20:36), and Noah Benevides (8th, 20:52), all in personal record times. Bishop Stang 15, Durfee 50; Bishop Stang 15, Fairhaven 46: At Bishop Stang (3.1 miles) in Dartmouth, freshman Dmitry Gauntt (17:27) of Stang finished first overall and senior captain Ryan Cardozo (17:40) was second. Carter Whitty (17:42) of Durfee was third. Stang took the next three spots behind Noah O’Toole (17:58), Jesse D’Almeida (18:13), and freshman Maxx Robles (18:40). Stang finished its dual meet season 4-4. Apponequet 22, Somerset Berkley 33: At Lakeville (2.9 miles), the Raiders (0-8) took 4-5-6 behind Tim Frechette (17:28), Austin Rodrigues (17:39), and Dan Johnson (18:00) in this non-league loss. Girls’ Cross Country Page 2 of 3 - Diman 15, Tri-County 50 (forfeit): At Franklin (3.1 miles), the Bengals (11-1) posted this Mayflower Athletic Conference shutout. Tri-County did not have five runners. Sydnee Midura (21:43) won the race. Diman took places 3-7 behind Storm Bastille (24:31), Ally Toupin (24:52), Bre-anna Treloar (26:27), Gina Trojano (26:46), and Kayla Lima (27:06). Also for Diman, Layla Pacheco (29:40) was ninth and Danielle Jones (29:50) 10th. Somerset Berkley 20, Apponequet 41: At Lakeville (2.9 miles), Kate Faria (2nd, 21:28), Caitlyn Lourenco (3rd, 21:36), Natalie Knight (4th, 23:42), Nicole Stuart (5th, 23:43), and Sadie Dohlborg (6th, 24:13) powered the Raiders (4-4) to this decisive win. Bishop Stang 15, Durfee 50; Fairhaven 21, Bishop Stang 37: At Bishop Stang (3.1 miles) in Dartmouth, Stang junior captain MaryLyn Sullivan (21:05) finished first overall. Also for Stang (5-3 final record), Olivia Wrobleski (23:24) was sixth, Elaina Alzaibak (24:19) ninth, and Jen Chen (25:13) 10th. Norfolk Agricultural 17, Bishop Connolly 44: At Walpole (3.1 miles), all of the Cougar runners posted personal record times in this Mayflower Athletic Conference loss. The top Connolly finishers were Cynthia Bai (4th, 26:45), Imogen Angel (8th, 29:14), Michelle Lanctot (9th, 29:16), Jingyi Wu (11th, 30:33). Volleyball Somerset Berkley 3, Durfee 1: At Durfee’s Skip Karam Court, the Raiders (9-6) moved to within one win of playoff qualification by downing the Hilltoppers 15-25, 25-18, 25-10, 25-22. Rebecca Foley (15 assists, 3 aces), Megan Monte (7 kills, 11 digs), Breanna Wood (6 kills, 10 digs), and Maddie Pontes (5 blocks) were standouts for SB. Rafaela Ramos led the Toppers with nine kills and 11 digs, while Aurelys Oquendo added seven kills and five aces. Molly Pereira had nine aces. Westport 3, Avon 1: At Cariglia Gymnasium in Westport, the Wildcats (7-9, 7-7 for tournament purposes) posted this 25-20, 20-25, 25-12, 25-22 Mayflower Athletic Conference Comprehensive win. Lindsey Oliveira (5 kills, 3 aces), Hailey Charest (8 kills, 4 blocks), and Cierra Yim (8 aces, 7 assists) were among the top performers for Westport. Field Hockey West Bridgewater 3, Somerset Berkley 1: At Somerset, Christine Nasiff accounted for the lone Raider goal with an unassisted score in the second half. Alyssa Soares made eight saves for Somerset Berkley (10-3-1). Dighton-Rehoboth 6, Case 0: At D-R, all the scoring took place in the first half of this South Coast Conference game. Women's Tennis UMass Dartmouth 5, UMass Boston 2: At Dartmouth, the Corsairs advanced to the Little East Conference tournament semifinals for the eighth straight year. The No. 4 Corsairs (9-6) face No. 1 seed Rhode Island College (12-0, 8-0 LEC) in a 2 p.m. semifinal in Providence, R.I. College Field Hockey UMass Dartmouth 2, Bridgewater State 1: At Dartmouth, Jill Levrault of Somerset had the game-winning goal and an assist as the Corsairs (11-4, 7-2 league) won this Little East Conference game. Page 3 of 3 - Bridgewater is 7-8, 4-5 LEC. By Herald News Staff The Herald News, Fall River, MA By Herald News Staff Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 10:06 PM Updated at 10:32 PM
